name: 提摩太后书
description: 保罗在监狱中写给提摩太的最后书信，鼓励他继续传道并预备面对逼迫

verses.zh: 奉神旨意，照着在基督耶稣里生命的应许，作基督耶稣使徒的保罗，
verses.en: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, in keeping with the promise of life that is in Christ Jesus,

verses.zh: 写信给我的真儿子提摩太。愿恩惠、怜悯、平安从父神和我们主基督耶稣归与你！
verses.en: To Timothy, my dear son: Grace, mercy and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

verses.zh: 我感谢神，就是我接续祖先，用清洁的良心所事奉的神。祈祷的时候，不住的想念你，
verses.en: I thank God, whom I serve, as my ancestors did, with a clear conscience, as night and day I constantly remember you in my prayers.

verses.zh: 昼夜切切的想念你，盼望见你，你的眼泪使我想起你来，使我满心快乐。
verses.en: Recalling your tears, I long to see you, so that I may be filled with joy.

verses.zh: 想到你心里无伪之信，这信是先在你外祖母罗以，和你母亲，犹妮基心里的；我深信也在你心里。
verses.en: I am reminded of your sincere faith, for you share the faith that first filled your grandmother, Lois, and your mother, Eunice. And I know that same faith continues strong in you.

verses.zh: 为此我提醒你，使你将神藉我按手所给你的恩赐，再如火挑旺起来。
verses.en: For this reason I remind you to fan into flame the gift of God, which is in you through the laying on of my hands.

verses.zh: 因为神赐给我们，不是胆怯的心，乃是刚强、仁爱、谨守的心。
verses.en: For the Spirit God gave us does not make us timid, but gives us power, love and self-discipline.

verses.zh: 你不要以给我们的主作见证为耻，也不要以我这为主被囚的为耻；总要按神的能力，与我为福音同受苦难。
verses.en: So do not be ashamed of the testimony about our Lord or of me his prisoner. Rather, join with me in suffering for the gospel, by the power of God.

verses.zh: 神救了我们，以圣召召我们，不是按我们的行为，乃是按他的旨意和恩典；这恩典是万古之先，在基督耶稣里赐给我们的。
verses.en: He has saved us and called us to a holy life—not because of anything we have done but because of his own purpose and grace. This grace was given us in Christ Jesus before the beginning of time,

verses.zh: 但如今藉着我们救主基督耶稣的显现，才表明出来了。他已经把死废去，藉着福音，将不能坏的生命彰显出来。
verses.en: but it has now been revealed through the appearing of our Savior, Christ Jesus, who has destroyed death and has brought life and immortality to light through the gospel.

verses.zh: 我为这福音奉派作传道的，作使徒，作师傅。
verses.en: And of this gospel I was appointed a herald and an apostle and a teacher.

verses.zh: 为这缘故，我也受这些苦难。然而我不以为耻。因为知道我所信的是谁，也深信他能保全我所交付他的，直到那日。
verses.en: That is why I am suffering as I am. Yet this is no cause for shame, because I know whom I have believed, and am convinced that he is able to guard what I have entrusted to him until that day.

verses.zh: 你从我听的那纯正话语的规模，要用在基督耶稣里的信心和爱心，常常守着。
verses.en: What you heard from me, keep as the pattern of sound teaching, with faith and love in Christ Jesus.

verses.zh: 从前所交托你的善道，你要靠着那住在我们里面的圣灵，牢牢的守着。
verses.en: Guard the good deposit that was entrusted to you—guard it with the help of the Holy Spirit who lives in us.

verses.zh: 你知道凡在亚西亚的人都离弃我，其中有腓吉路和黑摩其尼。
verses.en: You know that everyone in the province of Asia has deserted me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.

verses.zh: 愿主怜悯阿尼色弗一家的人；因他屡次使我畅快，不以我的锁链为耻，
verses.en: May the Lord show mercy to the household of Onesiphorus, because he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my chains.

verses.zh: 反倒在罗马的时候，殷勤的找我，并且找着了。
verses.en: On the contrary, when he was in Rome, he searched hard for me until he found me.

verses.zh: 愿主使他在那日得主的怜悯。他在以弗所怎样多多的服事我，是你明明知道的。
verses.en: May the Lord grant that he will find mercy from the Lord on that day! You know very well in how many ways he helped me in Ephesus.

verses.zh: 我儿啊，你要在基督耶稣的恩典上刚强起来。
verses.en: You then, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

verses.zh: 你在许多见证人面前听见我所教训的，也要交托那忠心能教导别人的人。
verses.en: And the things you have heard me say in the presence of many witnesses entrust to reliable people who will also be qualified to teach others.

verses.zh: 你要和我同受苦难，好像基督耶稣的精兵。
verses.en: Join with me in suffering, like a good soldier of Christ Jesus.

verses.zh: 凡在军中当兵的，不将世务缠身，好叫那招他当兵的喜悦。
verses.en: No one serving as a soldier gets entangled in civilian affairs, but rather tries to please his commanding officer.

verses.zh: 人若在场上比武，非按规矩，就不得冠冕。
verses.en: Similarly, anyone who competes as an athlete does not receive the victor's crown except by competing according to the rules.

verses.zh: 劳力的农夫，必先得着果实。
verses.en: The hardworking farmer should be the first to receive a share of the crops.

verses.zh: 我所说的话你要思想，因为凡事主必给你聪明。
verses.en: Reflect on what I am saying, for the Lord will give you insight into all this.

verses.zh: 你要记念耶稣基督乃是大卫的后裔，他从死里复活，正合乎我所传的福音。
verses.en: Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, descended from David. This is my gospel,

verses.zh: 我为这福音受苦难，甚至被捆绑，像犯人一样。然而神的道却不被捆绑。
verses.en: for which I am suffering even to the point of being chained like a criminal. But God's word is not chained.

verses.zh: 所以我为选民凡事忍耐，叫他们也可以得着那在基督耶稣里的救恩，和永远的荣耀。
verses.en: Therefore I endure everything for the sake of the elect, that they too may obtain the salvation that is in Christ Jesus, with eternal glory.

verses.zh: 有可信的话说：我们若与基督同死，也必与他同活；
verses.en: Here is a trustworthy saying: If we died with him, we will also live with him;

verses.zh: 我们若能忍耐，也必和他一同作王；我们若不认他，他也必不认我们；
verses.en: if we endure, we will also reign with him. If we disown him, he will also disown us;

verses.zh: 我们纵然失信，他仍是可信的，因为他不能背乎自己。
verses.en: if we are faithless, he remains faithful, for he cannot disown himself.

verses.zh: 你要使众人回想这些事，在主面前嘱咐他们：不可为言语争辩；这是没有益处的，只能败坏听见的人。
verses.en: Keep reminding God's people of these things. Warn them before God against quarreling about words; it is of no value, and only ruins those who listen.

verses.zh: 你当竭力在神面前得蒙喜悦，作无愧的工人，按着正意分解真理的道。
verses.en: Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved, a worker who does not need to be ashamed and who correctly handles the word of truth.

verses.zh: 但要远避世俗的虚谈，因为这等人必进到更不敬虔的地步。
verses.en: Avoid godless chatter, because those who indulge in it will become more and more ungodly.

verses.zh: 他们的话如同毒疮，越烂越大。其中有许米乃和腓罗，都是这样的人。
verses.en: Their teaching will spread like gangrene. Among them are Hymenaeus and Philetus,

verses.zh: 已经偏离了真道，说复活的事已过，就败坏好些人的信心。
verses.en: who have departed from the truth. They say that the resurrection has already taken place, and they destroy the faith of some.

verses.zh: 然而，神坚固的根基立住了；上面有这印记说：主认识谁是他的人；又说：凡称呼主名的人，总要离开不义。
verses.en: Nevertheless, God's solid foundation stands firm, sealed with this inscription: 'The Lord knows those who are his,' and, 'Everyone who confesses the name of the Lord must turn away from wickedness.'

verses.zh: 在大户人家，不但有金器银器，也有木器瓦器；有作为贵重的，有作为卑贱的。
verses.en: In a large house there are articles not only of gold and silver, but also of wood and clay; some are for special purposes and some for common use.

verses.zh: 人若自洁，脱离卑贱的事，就必作贵重的器皿，成为圣洁，合乎主用，预备行各样的善事。
verses.en: Those who cleanse themselves from the latter will be instruments for special purposes, made holy, useful to the Master and prepared to do any good work.

verses.zh: 你要逃避少年的私欲，同那清心祷告主的人追求公义、信德、仁爱、和平。
verses.en: Flee the evil desires of youth and pursue righteousness, faith, love and peace, along with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

verses.zh: 惟有那愚拙无学问的辩论，总要弃绝，因为知道这等事是起争竞的。
verses.en: Don't have anything to do with foolish and stupid arguments, because you know they produce quarrels.

verses.zh: 然而主的仆人不可争竞，只要温温和和的待众人，善于教导，存心忍耐，
verses.en: And the Lord's servant must not be quarrelsome but must be kind to everyone, able to teach, not resentful.

verses.zh: 用温柔劝戒那抵挡的人；或者神给他们悔改的心，可以明白真道，
verses.en: Opponents must be gently instructed, in the hope that God will grant them repentance leading them to a knowledge of the truth,

verses.zh: 叫他们清醒过来，脱离魔鬼的网罗；因为他们被魔鬼任意掳去，是要遵行他的旨意。
verses.en: and that they will come to their senses and escape from the trap of the devil, who has taken them captive to do his will.

verses.zh: 你该知道，末世必有危险的日子来到。
verses.en: But mark this: There will be terrible times in the last days.

verses.zh: 因为那时人要专顾自己、贪爱钱财、自夸、狂傲、谤讟、违背父母、忘恩负义、不圣洁、
verses.en: People will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, proud, abusive, disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, unholy,

verses.zh: 无亲情、不解怨、好说谗言、不能自约、性情凶暴、不爱良善、
verses.en: without love, unforgiving, slanderous, without self-control, brutal, not lovers of the good,

verses.zh: 卖主卖友、任意妄为、自高自大、爱宴乐、不爱神、
verses.en: treacherous, rash, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God—

verses.zh: 有敬虔的外貌，却背了敬虔的实意；这等人你要躲开。
verses.en: having a form of godliness but denying its power. Have nothing to do with such people.

verses.zh: 那偷进人家、牢笼无知妇女的，正是这等人。这些妇女担负罪恶，被各样的私欲引诱。
verses.en: They are the kind who worm their way into homes and gain control over gullible women, who are loaded down with sins and are swayed by all kinds of evil desires,

verses.zh: 常常学习，终久不能明白真道。
verses.en: that go on incessantly learning but are never able to come to a knowledge of the truth.

verses.zh: 从前雅尼和佯庇怎样敌挡摩西，这等人也怎样敌挡真道。他们的心地坏了，在真道上是可废弃的。
verses.en: Just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so also these teachers oppose the truth. They are men of depraved minds, who, as far as the faith is concerned, are rejected.

verses.zh: 然而他们不能再这样敌挡，因为他们的愚昧必在众人面前显露出来，像那二人一样。
verses.en: But they will not get very far because, as in the case of those men, their folly will be clear to everyone.

verses.zh: 但你已经服从了我的教训、品行、志向、信心、宽容、爱心、忍耐、
verses.en: You, however, know all about my teaching, my way of life, my purpose, faith, patience, love, endurance,

verses.zh: 以及我在安提阿、以哥念、路司得所遭遇的逼迫、苦难。我所忍受是何等的逼迫；但从这一切苦难中，主都把我救出来了。
verses.en: persecutions, sufferings—what kinds of things happened to me in Antioch, Iconium and Lystra, the persecutions I endured. Yet the Lord rescued me from all of them.

verses.zh: 凡立志在基督耶稣里敬虔度日的，也都要受逼迫。
verses.en: In fact, everyone who wants to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will be persecuted,

verses.zh: 只是作恶的和迷惑人的，必越久越恶，他欺哄人，也被人欺哄。
verses.en: while evildoers and impostors will go from bad to worse, deceiving and being deceived.

verses.zh: 但你所学习的，所确信的，要守住。因为你知道是从谁学的。
verses.en: But as for you, continue in what you have learned and have become convinced of, because you know those from whom you learned it,

verses.zh: 并且知道你是从小明白圣经，这圣经能使你因信基督耶稣有得救的智慧。
verses.en: and how from infancy you have known the Holy Scriptures, which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.

verses.zh: 圣经都是神所默示的，于教训、督责、使人归正、教导人学义都是有益的，
verses.en: All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness,

verses.zh: 叫属神的人得以完全，预备行各样的善事。
verses.en: so that the servant of God may be thoroughly equipped for every good work.

verses.zh: 我在神面前，并在将来审判活人死人的基督耶稣面前，凭着他的显现和他的国度嘱咐你：
verses.en: In the presence of God and of Christ Jesus, who will judge the living and the dead, and in view of his appearing and his kingdom, I give you this charge:

verses.zh: 务要传道，无论得时不得时，总要专心，并用百般的忍耐，各样的教训，责备人，劝勉人，训诫人。
verses.en: Preach the word; be prepared in season and out of season; correct, rebuke and encourage—with great patience and careful instruction.

verses.zh: 因为时候要到，人必厌烦纯正的道理，耳朵发痒，就随从自己的情欲，增添好些师傅。
verses.en: For the time will come when people will not put up with sound doctrine. Instead, to suit their own desires, they will gather around them a great number of teachers to say what their itching ears want to hear.

verses.zh: 并且掩耳不听真道，偏向荒渺的言语。
verses.en: They will turn their ears away from the truth and turn aside to myths.

verses.zh: 你却要凡事谨慎，忍受苦难，做传道的工夫，尽你的职分。
verses.en: But you, keep your head in all situations, endure hardship, do the work of an evangelist, discharge all the duties of your ministry.

verses.zh: 我现在被浇奠，我离世的时候到了。
verses.en: For I am already being poured out like a drink offering, and the time for my departure is near.

verses.zh: 那美好的仗我已经打过了，当跑的路我已经跑尽了，所信的道我已经守住了。
verses.en: I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith.

verses.zh: 从此以后，有公义的冠冕为我存留，就是按着公义审判的主到了那日要赐给我的；不但赐给我，也赐给凡爱慕他显现的人。
verses.en: Now there is in store for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will award to me on that day—and not only to me, but also to all who have longed for his appearing.

verses.zh: 你要赶紧的到我这里来。
verses.en: Do your best to come to me quickly,

verses.zh: 因为底马贪爱现今的世界，就离弃我往帖撒罗尼迦去了；革勒士往加拉太去了；提多往挞马太去了。
verses.en: for Demas, because he loved this world, has deserted me and has gone to Thessalonica. Crescens has gone to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia.

verses.zh: 独有路加在我这里。你可以接马可来，因为他在传道的事上于我有益处。
verses.en: Only Luke is with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, because he is helpful to me in my ministry.

verses.zh: 我已经打发推基古往以弗所去。
verses.en: I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.

verses.zh: 我来的时候，要把我在特罗亚留于加布的那件外衣带来，书籍也要带来，更要紧的是那些皮卷。
verses.en: When you come, bring the cloak that I left with Carpus at Troas, and my scrolls, especially the parchments.

verses.zh: 铜匠亚力山大多多的害我；主必照他所行的报应他。
verses.en: Alexander the metalworker did me a great deal of harm. The Lord will repay him for what he has done.

verses.zh: 你也要防备他，因为他极力敌挡我们的话。
verses.en: You too should be on your guard against him, because he strongly opposed our message.

verses.zh: 我初次申诉，没有人前来帮助，竟都离弃我。但愿这罪不归与他们。
verses.en: At my first defense, no one came to my support, but everyone deserted me. May it not be held against them.

verses.zh: 惟有主站在我旁边，加给我力量，使福音被我尽都传明，叫外邦人都听见；我也从狮子口里被救出来。
verses.en: But the Lord stood at my side and gave me strength, so that through me the message might be fully proclaimed and all the Gentiles might hear it. And I was delivered from the lion's mouth.

verses.zh: 主必救我脱离诸般的凶恶，也必救我进他的天国。愿荣耀归给他，直到永永远远。阿们！
verses.en: The Lord will rescue me from every evil attack and will bring me safely to his heavenly kingdom. To him be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

verses.zh: 问百基拉、亚居拉，和阿尼色弗一家的人安。
verses.en: Greet Priscilla and Aquila and the household of Onesiphorus.

verses.zh: 以拉都在哥林多住下了。特罗非摩病了，我就留他在米利都。
verses.en: Erastus stayed in Corinth, and I left Trophimus sick in Miletus.

verses.zh: 你要赶紧在冬天以前来。犹布罗、布田、利奴、革老底亚，和众弟兄都问你安。
verses.en: Do your best to get here before winter. Eubulus greets you, and so do Pudens, Linus, Claudia and all the brothers and sisters.

verses.zh: 愿主与你的灵同在！愿恩惠常与你们同在！
verses.en: The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with you all.
